Server¶

The Flask code is split into five files:

  1. Server Entry Point (server.py) – Entry point for the Flask app, handles serving the static files
  2. Backend (backend.py) – Foundation for the backend endpoints
  3. Data Downloading & Processing (data.py) – Handles the fetching of data from external sources, and processing them
  4. Student Functions (student.py) – Functions called by student endpoints
  5. Faculty Functions (faculty.py) – Functions called by faculty endpoints

Server Entry Point (server.py)¶

The server.py file serves the static pages, and expects Vue (on the static pages) to poll the backend for information.

server.index()[source]¶

Serves the welcome page

server.facultyIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the faculty portal

server.studentIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the student portal

server.helpIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the Sphinx documentation

server.add_header(r)[source]¶

Add headers to force the browser to not cache static files. To make it easier for development, can be safely removed in production.

Backend (backend.py)¶

The backend.py file fetches the data needed (by calling data.fetchData()) and exposes the data to the frontend via REST endpoints.

backend.fetchPrereqsEndpoint(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to start fetching prerequisites for a module

backend.callFetchData()[source]¶

Endpoint to start fetching data

Called when server is started, or when the refresh data button is pressed in Faculty side.

backend.fetchDataStatus()[source]¶

Fetch the current status of data fetching (as an integer from 0 to 100)

backend.fetchModuleDescription(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch module details of a module

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:JSON object containing title, description and tags dictionary of a module
Return type:string
backend.mainOverview(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch all relevant details to display on main page for a given module_code

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:JSON object of module details. Contains number of students, unfinished webcast, unviewed forum posts, and tutorial attendance.
Return type:string
backend.moduleDemographics(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch information for the module demographics tab

backend.moduleEnrolment(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch information for the module enrolment tab

backend.moduleAcademicsFac(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch information for the module academics tab

backend.get_student_info(token)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch all information of a particular student

backend.getPrereqs(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch prerequisites of a module

backend.getTeachingFeedback(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch students’ review of a professor

backend.getModuleFeedback(module_code)[source]¶

Endpoint to fetch students’ review of a module

backend.getTags(tag_name)[source]¶

Fetch information of a tag - number of clicks, modules with same tag, etc

backend.setCountTags(tag_name)[source]¶

Update local tag dictionary on number of times a specific tag is clicked

Parameters:tag_name (string) – tag name
Returns:name of tag whose count is updated
Return type:string
backend.getSEPUni(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch list of partner universities and their respective modules which can be mapped to this module

Data Downloading & Processing (data.py)¶

data.fetchPrereqs(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch a list of prerequisites for a given module code. Uses nusmods’ API.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Prerequisities for a given module code, returns an empty list of module is not found
Return type:list
data.fetchGoogleSheet(url_num, sheet_name)[source]¶

Query data from Google spreadsheet. Data obtained from https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lWEWGZBM1sSIAHUDIcIhfo9MJQUjao3v52Qp5VRyEZM/

Parameters:
  • url_num (integer) – Representing which ‘part’ (1 or 2) the sheet belongs to
  • sheet_name (string) – Name of sheet to pull data from
Returns:

Results from Google spreadsheet
Return type:

Pandas dataframe
data.fetchFirebase(url)[source]¶

Query data from Firebase.

Parameters:url (string) – Firebase URL
Returns:Results from Firebase database
Return type:Pandas dataframe
data.fetchData()[source]¶

Fetch and process all the data that we need.

Helper function that starts a thread for each data source to be pulled. Is called when the server is first launched, and can be refreshed by calling http://localhost:5000/bt3103-app/backend/fetch_data

data.getScore(x)[source]¶

Maps letter grade to numeric score.

Parameters:x (string) – Letter grade
Returns:Numeric grade of a grade, nan is grade is not found (eg. S/U)
Return type:float
data.calculate_cap()[source]¶

Calculate CAP score for each student in the database after fetching module enrolment.

data.countsAsDict(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, and returns a dict.

Parameters:
  • df (Pandas dataframe) – Dataframe that contains the data to be counted
  • column_name (string) – Name of the column to be counted
Returns:

A dictionary with keys ‘labels’, ‘counts’, and ‘students’ with each value being a list.
Return type:

dict

Examples

>>> countsAsDict(df, column_name)
>>> {'labels': ['A', 'B'], 'counts': [2, 4], 'tokens': ['Token1', 'Token2']}
data.countsAsLists(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, returns as nested lists.

Parameters:
  • df (Pandas dataframe) – Dataframe that contains the data to be counted
  • column_name (string) – Name of the column to be counted
Returns:

A nested list where each sublist includes details of a label. Sublist consist of label name, count, and a list of students.
Return type:

Pandas series

Examples

>>> countsAsLists(df, column_name)
>>> [["A", 1, ['Token1', 'Token2']], ["B", 2, ['Token3']]]
data.module_all_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:All module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.module_current_term(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Latest semester’s module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.module_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Previous semesters’ module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.program_current_term(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Program enrolment for students currently taking a particular module
Return type:Pandas series
data.program_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Program enrolment for students who previously took the module
Return type:Pandas series

Student Functions (student.py)¶

student.getPrereqs(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch prerequisites of a module

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A nested dictionary with keys name, parent, and children. Value of children is a list.
Return type:dict
student.getTeachingFeedback(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch student reviews (teaching) of a professor

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A dictionary with keys data, tAbility, tTimely, and tInterest. Values of tAbility, tTimely, and tInterest are lists.
Return type:dict
student.getModuleFeedback(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch student reviews of a module

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A dictionary with keys data, mRating, goodText, and badText. Values of mRating, goodText, and badText are lists.
Return type:dict
student.getSEPUni(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch list of partner universities which can map particular module to

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A list of objects with name of partner university as key, and module code of mapped module as value.
Return type:list

Faculty Functions (faculty.py)¶

faculty.getModuleGrades(module_code=None, program_subset=None)[source]¶

Filter grades by module_code and/or a list of tokens

Parameters:
  • module_code (string, optional) – module code
  • program_subset (Pandas DataFrame, optional) – Subset of program enrolment dataframe
Returns:

A dictionary of keys counts and students. Depending on input arguments, dictionary consists of grades with this module code and/ or grades belonging to students in the program subset.
Return type:

dict
faculty.get_faculty_tag_counts(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch list of tags and tags count for the module.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:List of objects with tag name as key and number of clicks (count) as value. List is sorted alphabetically by tag name.
Return type:list
faculty.demographics(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch all demographic data to be displayed for a given module code.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A dictionary of keys degrees, academic_career, faculty, academic_load and years.
Return type:dict
faculty.getPrereqGrades(token, prereqs)[source]¶

For each student, check which prerequisites have been taken, and how the student fared. Used in enrolment function.

Parameters:token (string) – student token number
Returns:Concatenation of current module’s prerequisites’ module code and respective letter grade student has received.
Return type:string
faculty.enrolment(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch all student enrolment data to be displayed for a given module code.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:A dictionary of keys attendance, webcast, CAP, and prereqs.
Return type:dict
faculty.calculate_influence_scores(module_past, module_code)[source]¶

Statistical analysis part 1. Perform statistical analysis on students based on their results of the modules they have taken. Specifically, the accummulated difference of their final marks and the modules’ average final marks. Used in academics function.

faculty.identify_potential_students(module_current, module_influence_scores, all_bool, fac_set=None)[source]¶

Statistical analysis part 2. Identify students who are doing above and below average for module. Student are grouped by their home faculties. Used in academics function.

faculty.calculate_grade_distribution(set, results, key)[source]¶

Calculate the grade distribution of current students. Used in academics function.

faculty.modules_per_student(fac_set, results, key)[source]¶

Count number of modules that each student is taking this semester. Used in academics function.

faculty.academics(module_code)[source]¶

Fetch all academic data to be displayed for a given module code. Includes option/ dictionary to filter information by faculties.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
faculty.student_info(token)[source]¶

Fetch all information about a student.

Parameters:token (string) – student token number
Returns:A dictionary with keys information, curr_modules, and past_modules. Values of each key is a Pandas series/ dataframe.
Return type:dict
